Key Arguments: The submission strongly opposes any form of censorship, emphasizing the importance of freedom of speech in a democracy.
The author argues that government intervention in determining truth constitutes overreach and poses a conflict of interest, particularly with multinational corporations.
The submission stresses the importance of engagement, discussion, debate, and diverse opinions in nurturing democracy.
Notable Quotes: Everyone is entitled to freedom of speech in a true democracy, whose foundation is individual agency and intellectual autonomy.
Assuming the role of protector and condescending to arbitrate on what is truth and what is not truth, is gross government overreach.
